column4: Trying to get Nomachine NX (commercial version) to work on Ubuntu 10. Been through http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1546856 and the Nomachine isntall guides. When I attempt to connect though Im getting what appears to be an auth issue with nxnode. Anyone have this working by chance? TIA
I'm working on a different problem with NX client but I was able to get it to work on 10.10 -- just needed to make sure to import the correct key into your client
I have the correct key. Its something freaking out sever side with "nxnode".
I have even tried it without changing keys so nothing should have to be done. Does the samething.

I have been running Fedora 10 for a while and using NX to connect to the FreeNX server and it's very fast and looks awesome. Almost like being at the desktop.  I just installed Ubuntu 10.10 and when I run NX /FreeNX it's almost unusable. The two servers are on the same internet switch and being accessed from the same external computer so I'm very confused.
Seems ive read something about that along the way. I seem to recall a mention of disabling some kind of Rendering attribute for the X server.
Yah Im using Nomachine with RHEL and Fedora with no issues. Im trying ubuntu because I want to try Biolinux which is ubuntu based.
Are you referring to the Xdamage option in Ubuntu? I tried that but it made an extremely minor positive change.
No. Let me see if I can find it again...
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1590440   At least I dont think its the samething.
that is a different option - I am trying it now
Just logged out and back in again to test it.  No difference unfortunately :(

with respect to your nxnode issue, I'm not sure what to recommend. I didn't have any issue getting it running. I did install it using apt-get rather than downloading anything from freenx or so. (I understood there were different ways to get it installed)
nope - all desktop effects are off
Yah Im running NoMachine NX not FreeNX.
